info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 01 at 3:02AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN PIKE...SOUTHEASTERN ADAMS AND BROWN COUNTIES IN WEST CENTRAL ILLINOIS... At 301 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Buckhorn, moving east at 50 mph. This storm has a history of producing 62 mph wind gusts at the Quincy Airport. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Mount Sterling, Camp Point, Clayton, Beverly, Buckhorn, La Grange, Kingston, Liberty, Versailles, Richfield, Chambersburg, Coatsburg, Mound Station, Columbus, Ripley, Kellerville, Fishhook, and Coopertown. This also includes Siloam Springs State Park. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
